text: Calling all crochet lovers! This roundup is for you! Old-school pastimes, like baking, needlepoint, and, of course, crochet, are making a big comeback. Nowadays, people affectionately refer to these activities as grandma hobbies. I have a lot of fond memories of my grandmother sitting in her chair, crocheting afghans and tissue box cozies. I even recently picked up a few basic supplies and decided to give it a try.  Crochet is fun at any age, and if you’re new to it, you only need to look as far as YouTube to find countless how-to tutorials. You’ll find patterns for crochet stuffed animals, lamps, chair covers, and more. Whether you’re a beginner or an expert at all things yarn, these IKEA hacks are sure to inspire you toward crochet greatness. Want more inspiring IKEA hacks? Sign up for our free weekly newsletter for the latest hacks, ideas, IKEA updates, and more! 1. Crochet GRÖNÖ Lamp Photo Credit: Ólöf Lilja Eyþórsdóttir This cute hack from Ólöf gives the IKEA GRÖNÖ lamp a whole new look. The lamp cover adds a cozy edge to the modern fixture and also gives it a more feminine, softer style. 2. Cozy Lampshades for IKEA Pendants Photo Credit: Rose White (Crochet Today Magazine) Rose White from Crochet Today Magazine shows how colorful yarn can completely transform a few basic light fixtures. These crochet lampshades add a splash of color and a unique look to the IKEA MELODI lamp and two former products, the MINUT and MÅNLJUS pendants. Get the pattern on Etsy. 3. POKAL Glass Sleeves Photo Credit: Steffi The next time your beverage is a little too icy or too hot to handle, don’t stop sipping. Keep enjoying your drink thanks to these glass cozies. Steffi created the crochet sleeves for the IKEA POKAL glass, but you could apply the concept to different styles. 4. An Artsy Stool Cover Photo Credit: Kristin This artsy stool cover is courtesy of Kristin. She decided to put her own spin on the IKEA MARIUS stool using freeform crochet and a few fun bird patterns. Kristin also made crochet tubes to cover the legs. 5. A Fresh Look for the POÄNG Chair Photo Credit: Heather The popular IKEA POÄNG armchair gets a fresh, floral facelift thanks to this chair cover from Heather. Heather loved the chair and how comfy it was, but it had acquired a few stains over the years. Her crochet creation solved that problem and made the piece more personal. 6. BEKVÄM Stool Cover Photo Credit: Maite This cute crochet seat cover adds whimsy and color to the BEKVÄM stool (now in a slightly revised style). The hack, from Maite, features a popular “Sunburst Granny” pattern in the center. Maite then kept adding rows until the cover fit. 7. Give Your GALEJ Some Glitz Photo Credit: Marion Need to add a little sparkle to your next dinner party? This IKEA crochet hack from Marion showcases adding a little glitz to the simple, glass GALEJ tealight holders. The sparkle covers are a mix of beads, thin wire, and crochet magic. 8. Cute Coffee Sweater Photo Credit: Lisa Broer Keep your coffee steamy longer with an adorable coffee sweater. Lisa Broer crafted this crochet cover for her UPPHETTA French press coffee maker and was happy to report it keeps her coffee warm for an hour and a half. 9. Ruffled Lampshade Photo Credit: Joanne L. This sweet ruffled lampshade is a great addition for a girl’s bedroom or to add a feminine touch to any space. Joanne L. made the lamp cover for the IKEA SKIRMA table lamp, which is now discontinued. However, you could apply the idea to similar tapered lamps to achieve the same look. 10. An Elevated Look for a Paper Shade Photo Credit: Raquel The REGOLIT paper shade is an IKEA staple, but sometimes, you want something with a bit more pizazz. Raquel decided to upgrade the classic shade with a little bit of yarn, creating a crochet overlay that really alters the entire vibe, giving it more of a Boho look. 11. Fancy Footstool Photo Credit: Tilda Tilda created a cute and colorful footstool cover for her hacked BESTÅ cabinet. She flipped the cabinet on its side to turn it into a storage ottoman, padding the cabinet door and covering it in crochet art to make a cozy, sweet topper. 12. Crochet Bed Canopy Photo Credit: Juliana Pinto Juliana Pinto repurposed her grandmother’s crochet blanket into a beautiful bed cover using the KURA bed tent. The tent base was the perfect frame for the blanket. If you don’t have a crochet blanket, make one to match your room’s style and colors, or search your favorite vintage boutique. 13. Classic Chairs Get a Crochet Upgrade Photo Credit: CreatiVIPY.com This DIY project features an update for a pair of IKEA ROGER chairs that get a makeover with white paint and fabric. The cherry on top of this hack is the black crochet details. I especially love the added storage the crochet swing provides on the bottom of one of the chairs. 14. Crochet Privacy Curtain Photo Credit: Paloma When you want a little extra privacy, try this room divider hack from Paloma, which features IKEA’s KOMPLEMENT multi-use hangers. The crochet circles were made by a cherished family member, adding a special personal touch to the piece. However, you could also get a similar effect using doilies or fabric if you’re still developing your crochet skills. 15. Cute Crochet Cover for Bluetooth Speaker Photo Credit: Wineke Technology is grand, except when it stands out like a sore thumb in your stylish space. That’s why Wineke decided to make a cute little hat for a Bluetooth speaker. The cover enhances the look of their VAPPEBY lamp and speaker without sacrificing sound quality. What do you think about these creative crochet hacks? There’s something for everyone, even if you’re new to the world of crochet. Have a hack to share? Tell us all about it! Calling all crochet lovers! This roundup is for you! Old-school pastimes, like baking, needlepoint, and, of course, crochet, are making a big comeback.

Nowadays, people affectionately refer to these activities as grandma hobbies. I have a lot of fond memories of my grandmother sitting in her chair, crocheting afghans and tissue box cozies. I even recently picked up a few basic supplies and decided to give it a try. 

Crochet is fun at any age, and if you’re new to it, you only need to look as far as YouTube to find countless how-to tutorials. You’ll find patterns for crochet stuffed animals, lamps, chair covers, and more.

Whether you’re a beginner or an expert at all things yarn, these IKEA hacks are sure to inspire you toward crochet greatness.

  • Want more inspiring IKEA hacks? Sign up for our free weekly newsletter for the latest hacks, ideas, IKEA updates, and more!

1. Crochet GRÖNÖ Lamp

This cute hack from Ólöf gives the IKEA GRÖNÖ lamp a whole new look. The lamp cover adds a cozy edge to the modern fixture and also gives it a more feminine, softer style.

2. Cozy Lampshades for IKEA Pendants

Rose White from Crochet Today Magazine shows how colorful yarn can completely transform a few basic light fixtures. These crochet lampshades add a splash of color and a unique look to the IKEA MELODI lamp and two former products, the MINUT and MÅNLJUS pendants. Get the pattern on Etsy.

3. POKAL Glass Sleeves

The next time your beverage is a little too icy or too hot to handle, don’t stop sipping. Keep enjoying your drink thanks to these glass cozies. Steffi created the crochet sleeves for the IKEA POKAL glass, but you could apply the concept to different styles.

4. An Artsy Stool Cover

This artsy stool cover is courtesy of Kristin. She decided to put her own spin on the IKEA MARIUS stool using freeform crochet and a few fun bird patterns. Kristin also made crochet tubes to cover the legs.

5. A Fresh Look for the POÄNG Chair

The popular IKEA POÄNG armchair gets a fresh, floral facelift thanks to this chair cover from Heather. Heather loved the chair and how comfy it was, but it had acquired a few stains over the years. Her crochet creation solved that problem and made the piece more personal.

6. BEKVÄM Stool Cover

This cute crochet seat cover adds whimsy and color to the BEKVÄM stool (now in a slightly revised style). The hack, from Maite, features a popular “Sunburst Granny” pattern in the center. Maite then kept adding rows until the cover fit.

7. Give Your GALEJ Some Glitz

Need to add a little sparkle to your next dinner party? This IKEA crochet hack from Marion showcases adding a little glitz to the simple, glass GALEJ tealight holders. The sparkle covers are a mix of beads, thin wire, and crochet magic.

8. Cute Coffee Sweater

Keep your coffee steamy longer with an adorable coffee sweater. Lisa Broer crafted this crochet cover for her UPPHETTA French press coffee maker and was happy to report it keeps her coffee warm for an hour and a half.

9. Ruffled Lampshade

This sweet ruffled lampshade is a great addition for a girl’s bedroom or to add a feminine touch to any space. Joanne L. made the lamp cover for the IKEA SKIRMA table lamp, which is now discontinued. However, you could apply the idea to similar tapered lamps to achieve the same look.

10. An Elevated Look for a Paper Shade

The REGOLIT paper shade is an IKEA staple, but sometimes, you want something with a bit more pizazz. Raquel decided to upgrade the classic shade with a little bit of yarn, creating a crochet overlay that really alters the entire vibe, giving it more of a Boho look.

11. Fancy Footstool

Tilda created a cute and colorful footstool cover for her hacked BESTÅ cabinet. She flipped the cabinet on its side to turn it into a storage ottoman, padding the cabinet door and covering it in crochet art to make a cozy, sweet topper.

12. Crochet Bed Canopy

Juliana Pinto repurposed her grandmother’s crochet blanket into a beautiful bed cover using the KURA bed tent. The tent base was the perfect frame for the blanket. If you don’t have a crochet blanket, make one to match your room’s style and colors, or search your favorite vintage boutique.

13. Classic Chairs Get a Crochet Upgrade

This DIY project features an update for a pair of IKEA ROGER chairs that get a makeover with white paint and fabric. The cherry on top of this hack is the black crochet details. I especially love the added storage the crochet swing provides on the bottom of one of the chairs.

14. Crochet Privacy Curtain

When you want a little extra privacy, try this room divider hack from Paloma, which features IKEA’s KOMPLEMENT multi-use hangers. The crochet circles were made by a cherished family member, adding a special personal touch to the piece. However, you could also get a similar effect using doilies or fabric if you’re still developing your crochet skills.

15. Cute Crochet Cover for Bluetooth Speaker

Technology is grand, except when it stands out like a sore thumb in your stylish space. That’s why Wineke decided to make a cute little hat for a Bluetooth speaker. The cover enhances the look of their VAPPEBY lamp and speaker without sacrificing sound quality.

What do you think about these creative crochet hacks? There’s something for everyone, even if you’re new to the world of crochet.

Have a hack to share? Tell us all about it! We’re always looking for new ideas to inspire others!
